noun.description: A member of a black people living on the coast of South Carolina and nearby islands.
The Creole language of the Gullah, having an English base with elements from various West African languages. It has about 125,000 speakers.

adjective.description: Relating to the Gullah or their language.

origin: Perhaps a shortening of Angola, or from Gola, the name of an agricultural people of Liberia and Sierra Leone.
